title: City Hall, London
summary: City Hall is a building in London which served as the headquarters of the Greater London Authority (GLA) between July 2002 and December 2021. It is located in the borough of Southwark, on the south bank of the River Thames near Tower Bridge. In June 2020, the Greater London Authority started a consultation on proposals to vacate City Hall and move to The Crystal, a GLA owned property in Newham, at the end of 2021.[2] The decision was confirmed on 3 November 2020 and the GLA vacated City Hall on 2 December 2021.[3]
